content:
Hello all,

I don't know if this is the right place for this, so please remove if not. I've used a feature from nightly (std::iter::zip), and was wondering where it was at in the process. So I found the issue: (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/83574) and it seems to have been merged in March.

This sort of confuses me since the rust forge book gives a roughly 6 week progression from nightly to beta, and then from beta to stable, which I thought meant that post-merge, a feature takes roughly 12 weeks to get to stable. It seems like I was mistaken, so my question is two-fold:
1) What details am I missing from the process?
2) What stage is the above feature, and what steps need to be done for it to become stable?

Thanks!

@Patrick Poitras unfortunately "stable" has two meanings - 1. is the stable release channel, like 1.56 or 1.57, and 2. is "this feature can be used without a feature gate". So zip is only available on the stable release channel if you use a feature gate (and feature gates are a hard error unless you use nightly).

Ah I see! It's sort of already in the stable branch, but the feature gate requires the nightly release. That explains things.
Thanks very much for the answer!

@Patrick Poitras Also, the progression for a feature typically involves some amount of gathering experience with it, which is separate from the timelines of releases; depending on the feature and its complexity, that can take a variable amount of time.
But in this case, the feature seems simple enough, and I don't see any reported issues with it, so I've kicked off the FCP.
